Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific mention of sustainable or environmental practices being implemented within these projects or companies mentioned. However, some general observations can be made regarding potential positive impacts on the environment. For example, The Better Food Company is working towards improving the food system by growing fresh produce, which could contribute to reducing reliance on imported or transported goods, potentially lowering carbon emissions associated with food transportation. Additionally, Cambridge Shelter's goal of launching a sustainable social enterprise may involve eco-friendly practices such as waste reduction, recycling, or using energy-efficient methods. Nevertheless, without more detailed information, it is difficult to pinpoint exact sustainable or environmental practices being implemented.

source.content: by offering products and donation funds that create meaningful change Through an initial private foundation grant Cambridge Shelter hired us to Research Brand and Launch a sustainable social enterprise that will 1 employ shelter graduates 2 provide personal development opportunities for the shelter graduates and 3 provide undesignated revenue for Cambridge Shelter programming Over a period of a year we developed In our Backyard offering professional garden and yard services to those in the Waterloo Region while providing part and full time employment for their shelter clients We secured over  in additional grant funding which allowed us to hire a full-time coordinator and make capital investments into the enterprise You can visit the project website by clicking the button below Subscribe to be part of our insider mailing list and be the first to hear about our new projects partnerships and opportunities Our promise we will only share content that we would be excited to receive

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: On the B Impact Assessment, there are several environmental impact metrics that are reported. Some of these include greenhouse gas emissions (direct and indirect), energy use, water usage, waste production and management, and transportation-related impacts. By reporting on these metrics, B Corporations can track their progress towards reducing their environmental footprint and contribute to overall sustainability efforts.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided information, the organization has made several public commitments related to social and corporate responsibility. They are a Certified B Corporation, which means they are committed to creating social good and have undergone thorough audits of their financial statements and business practices. Additionally, they promise to provide real social impact through customer purchases, compensate creators fairly, offer high-quality products, support local businesses, and engage in activities that foster community building.

source.content: - are amongst the global top 5 in their corresponding size group These businesses are proving that competing not only to be the best in the world but the best for the world is a winning strategy and they can lead the way as more businesses continue to join the movement that is transforming the global economy to benefit all people communities and the planet The Community Company was recognized with the ‘Best for the World for Customers’ designation in July  Opinion article written by Justin Chan Guelph Mercury April 26  It used to be that for-profit businesses and non-profit organizations had their places one existed to make money and the other existed to make our community better But have you noticed that more for-profit businesses are creating social impact And more non-profit and charities are selling products At the intersection of business and non-profit is social enterprise and I believe non-profit are in the perfect position to become the leaders in this growing space Better

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
In the given text, there are several examples of partnerships and collaborations related to commerce. These include:

1. Partnering with B Corporations to ensure credibility and commitment to community betterment.
2. Collaborating with local suppliers and manufacturers to maintain an almost entirely local supply chain.
3. Working with local students and self-employed individuals to provide opportunities for growth within the creative industries.
4. Featuring one of their partners at each market event, allowing them to showcase their artwork and offer it for purchase.

These partnerships demonstrate The Community Company's dedication to supporting its community through commerce while promoting local talent and sustainable practices.

source.content: the world The Community Company has many markets lined up over the summer to showcase our community products - we have also decided to feature one of our partners at every market allowing them to showcase their amazing artwork and have them for purchase as well The following list is universal and it applies to both those experiencing adversity as well as our own friends and peers Here are four things you can do to empower your community Become An Ally This means truly listening to others as they share their passions goals and dreams with you Listen to connect and not just to create an answer or solution that you think is right - this is about building trust and journeying with an individual Here’s an amazing blog post on what it really means to be an ally for more inspiration Support their Passions At the end of the day purchasing products that people created shows that you support what they do and that you believe in them You could like their social media post You can say you support

in Canada When you partner with a B Corporation you can trust that you’re partnering with a credible organization that is using their business to make our community better The Community Company has created custom products for school boards businesses entrepreneurs universities and charities We’ve created everything from holiday cards thank you cards thank you gifts custom t-shirts apparel and tote bags Not only do we partner with individuals in our community to design our products our supply chain is almost entirely local Our products are screenprinted and embroidered in Waterloo Ontario Our cards are designed by a local graphic designer Our labels are woven by an incredible woman named Lenka When we work with photographers writers and artists we prioritize local students or self-employed individuals looking to grow their portfolio and business We acknowledge that it is not entirely possible to source certain materials locally but we promise to make our best efforts If reading all

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the information provided, there are several employment and educational opportunities available. Firstly, the author works in childcare teaching at a pre-school program in Toronto, which provides valuable education and care for young children. Additionally, the author has experience in art as a hobby and hopes to use her creativity to make a positive impact through her artwork. This could involve creating visual content for organizations focusing on mental health awareness or other social causes. Finally, JOE offers employment and training opportunities for adults with developmental disabilities, allowing them to engage with their communities and gain valuable work experience.

source.content: I am also currently going into my 4th year of Communication Studies at Wilfrid Laurier University My hobbies outside of work and school include hiking thrifting ultimate frisbee and hanging out with my dog  Co-created designs with Zach Nathan Susie and Ranju for the JOE Postcards project Worked with all five youth at oneROOF Youth Services to create our  Holiday Cards What are you most passionate aboutAs someone who struggles personally I’m very passionate about advocating for mental health and helping others feel seen  heard I’m also a self-proclaimed cat-lady so I’m also definitely passionate about cats and animals What do you do outside of this projectPart of my time I work in child care I teach at a great pre-school program in Toronto ON I’ve always practiced art as a hobby and through school but I’ve always wanted to use my hobby as a way to make even a small difference I hope to continue to spread mental health awareness/advocate for others like myself and others through my art

and offer employment for adults with developmental disabilities JOE is a registered charity based in Guelph Ontario focused on innovative community-based employment and job-training for adults with developmental disabilities If you would like to learn more about what they do you can visit their website below If you’re interested in offering a job opportunity please email  The purpose of our blog is to share knowledge resources and perspectives on the social causes that are important to our community Blogs are written by subject-matter experts including individuals with lived experience academics as well as those who work in the field We created our Reconnecting Ontario project in partnership with JOE Now that we're on step 3 of Reopening Ontario we are reminding our community to check in with our friends and family who we haven't heard from in a while and let them know they're loved and cared for “It’s very important for us to reach out to help people feel happy to share with them

really much to replace sheltered workshops beyond high-cost day programs  JOE is a Guelph-based charity that gives people with developmental disabilities opportunities to interact directly with the community in work environments Our coffee nook programs are a great example of that Prior to the pandemic when we were still running coffee nooks we had a regular customer base customers that would come in and say hi start conversations with our baristas JOE baristas became really confident in their skills working to their strengths Some worked as mentors for others that were just learning the ropes For me it was amazing to see people’s confidence build along with people’s relationships within the community When someone serves you a cup of coffee it’s a shared experience that you have with someone else Plus it’s fun having a job that you enjoy The coffee nooks were front-facing and tangible Folks at JOE still talk about their experiences as baristas volunteering at different locations in

else Plus it’s fun having a job that you enjoy The coffee nooks were front-facing and tangible Folks at JOE still talk about their experiences as baristas volunteering at different locations in town They talk about it like it’s yesterday It’s part of people’s identity It’s very transformative work In Training Grounds we talk alot about our dream jobs People dream about working at Tim Hortons or McDonalds Some dream about being an artist or a musician Working in theatre Working in a bookstore or with children Being a customer service representative People have all kinds of dream jobs Maybe business owners in the community have paper that needs shredding Or shelves that need to be stocked things that just need to be done And businesses in the community have the opportunity to step up and offer employment for adults with developmental disabilities JOE is a registered charity based in Guelph Ontario focused on innovative community-based employment and job-training for adults with

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the information provided, there aren't specific events mentioned related to job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs. However, JOE (Joe's Coffee Nook) provides coffee nook programs that give people with developmental disabilities opportunities to interact directly with the community in work environments. These programs could potentially lead to employment opportunities for adults with developmental disabilities.

source.content: really much to replace sheltered workshops beyond high-cost day programs  JOE is a Guelph-based charity that gives people with developmental disabilities opportunities to interact directly with the community in work environments Our coffee nook programs are a great example of that Prior to the pandemic when we were still running coffee nooks we had a regular customer base customers that would come in and say hi start conversations with our baristas JOE baristas became really confident in their skills working to their strengths Some worked as mentors for others that were just learning the ropes For me it was amazing to see people’s confidence build along with people’s relationships within the community When someone serves you a cup of coffee it’s a shared experience that you have with someone else Plus it’s fun having a job that you enjoy The coffee nooks were front-facing and tangible Folks at JOE still talk about their experiences as baristas volunteering at different locations in

and offer employment for adults with developmental disabilities JOE is a registered charity based in Guelph Ontario focused on innovative community-based employment and job-training for adults with developmental disabilities If you would like to learn more about what they do you can visit their website below If you’re interested in offering a job opportunity please email  The purpose of our blog is to share knowledge resources and perspectives on the social causes that are important to our community Blogs are written by subject-matter experts including individuals with lived experience academics as well as those who work in the field We created our Reconnecting Ontario project in partnership with JOE Now that we're on step 3 of Reopening Ontario we are reminding our community to check in with our friends and family who we haven't heard from in a while and let them know they're loved and cared for “It’s very important for us to reach out to help people feel happy to share with them

been my favourite language and I love to communicate it with people What do you do outside of this projectI just graduated Conestoga college for visual merchandising and I have learned so much in the past two years I am saving money at the moment so I can continue my education at OCAD for advertising next fall In my spare time I love to surround my self with nature and paint all day Photography provided for Videography provided for the  Holiday Cards Social Media You can learn more about Visuo Studios by following  on Instagram We are open to hearing more about how you think you can best fit into our work If you believe in what our organization stands for and want to be part of our growth you are welcome to proactively submit an application and let us know where you can add the most value for our organization Helping you build a better community One of  Certified B Corporations in Ontario About  Donate  Services  Projects  Privacy Policy  Contact We will only send you emails once a

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
The text mentions several employee or participant benefits that are highlighted by The Wellness Project. These include:

1. Recognition: Purchasers of Wellness Boxes will receive a digital certificate acknowledging their contributions to the community.
2. Rewards: Those who buy two or more Wellness Boxes will get a set of Physical Distancing Postcards as a reward.
3. Gifting opportunities: Individuals or organizations can directly gift a Wellness Box to someone in need through partnered charities.
4. Sponsorships: Businesses or organizations can sponsor an entire day's worth of Wellness Boxes and receive recognition for their generosity.

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result:
Based on the provided context, here are some recent developments mentioned in the articles:

1. Menstrual Equity (published on October 2nd): This concept focuses on ensuring equal access to period products and education around reproductive health.
2. The Coldest Night of the Year (published on September 9th): This event brings communities together to raise awareness and funds for those experiencing homelessness.
3. Social Business Launch (published on November 19th): The launch of a new social business aimed at inspiring and empowering the community.
4. Poverty Relief Agency (published on November 13th): HOPE House is leveraging the power of community to combat poverty and support individuals in need.
5. Volunteering Experience (published on June 13th): One individual shares how volunteering to help settle refugees led them to discover the importance of giving back to the community.

Research & Innovation.question: Are there any ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives? If yes then list them
Research & Innovation.result:
Yes, there are several ongoing and upcoming research projects and innovation initiatives related to The Better Food Company, The Community Company, and Emma Sawczuk's work. Here are some examples:

1. Ongoing Research Projects:
a. Exploring the impact of urban agriculture on food security and community wellbeing.
b. Investigating the effectiveness of educational programs focused on nutrition and healthy eating habits.
c. Analyzing the environmental benefits of locally sourced and sustainably grown produce.
d. Studying the economic advantages of supporting small-scale farmers and social enterprises.
2. Upcoming Innovation Initiatives:
a. Launching a mobile app that connects consumers with local farmers and social enterprises, promoting transparency and traceability in the food supply chain.
b. Developing a circular economy model for food waste reduction and resource recovery.
c. Implementing blockchain technology to enhance trust and accountability within the food system.
d. Collaborating with universities and research institutions to advance knowledge in regenerative agriculture practices and climate-smart technologies.

source.content: For media interested in writing an article on our work please scroll to the bottom for our contact form The Better Food Company growing fresh produce to help feed families in Guelph The Better Food Company has launched a new initiative to help feed families facing food insecurity in Guelph The Seed-to-Table Project aims to improve the food system by growing produce in Hope House Guelph’s garden The Better Food Company is a collaborative project between the charity Hope House and other local organizations Every year B Lab recognizes the top-performing B Corps creating great impact through their businesses These B Corps are named Best for the World™ as their verified scores in the five impact areas evaluated on the B Impact Assessment - community customers environment governance and workers - are amongst the global top 5 in their corresponding size group These businesses are proving that competing not only to be the best in the world but the best for the world is a winning strategy and

and in the news I’ve learned how to capture our community’s attention through product designs And most importantly I’ve learned how to create projects that truly empower the individuals that we work with The next chapter of The Community Company will involve doing this again And again We are now offering our services to the amazing charities and organizations in Canada We’re excited to journey alongside organizations to create their own social enterprise around the cause they’re most passionate about I believe social enterprise is the future for all community work It is the intersection of business and charity combining the efficiencies of business with the social impact of charities It allows organizations to sustain their important work beyond grants and donations all while building relationships with those that stand behind their cause You can visit wwwcommunitycompanyorg/social-enterprise-development to learn more about our new service offer For those who have followed my journey

source.content: and community-based research she creates effective enterprises that balance sustainability and social impact with our charity and nonprofit partners With a background in academic research she recognizes the crucial role that community engagement plays in driving meaningful positive social change  Outside of work Emma enjoys painting and hiking with her dog Kaz She values the importance of maintaining strong relationships and loves spending time connecting with her friends and family Justin founded The Community Company in  to connect with people overcoming adversity and creatively share their talents with the world Today The Community Company is creating sustainable Social Enterprises in partnership with our community's most inspiring charities nonprofits and grassroot groups With a background in both Business Administration and community organizing he brings a unique blend of experiences to every client project from investment management to nonprofit fundraising to launching

Our mission is to create a better economic system through community-led social enterprises With every successful project we are decentralizing wealth and reinvesting it into our communities You would describe yourself as someone who is passionate about community Through your day-to-day actions you’re making our community better whether it’s your work or your volunteering In the current system we live in money can be used to create change But as you know there’s an overwhelming number of ways that you can spend it So you’re often asking is this the best way to make a difference As you continue on your changemaking journey we would love to come alongside you and exchange ideas knowledge and strategies on how we can make the most impact together The front-line work that our local charities do to support our community is absolutely crucial At the same time it’s important to also see the bigger picture and understand what’s needed to create lasting change Bridging the gap between short-term

For media interested in writing an article on our work please scroll to the bottom for our contact form The Better Food Company growing fresh produce to help feed families in Guelph The Better Food Company has launched a new initiative to help feed families facing food insecurity in Guelph The Seed-to-Table Project aims to improve the food system by growing produce in Hope House Guelph’s garden The Better Food Company is a collaborative project between the charity Hope House and other local organizations Every year B Lab recognizes the top-performing B Corps creating great impact through their businesses These B Corps are named Best for the World™ as their verified scores in the five impact areas evaluated on the B Impact Assessment - community customers environment governance and workers - are amongst the global top 5 in their corresponding size group These businesses are proving that competing not only to be the best in the world but the best for the world is a winning strategy and

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve creating a better economic system, decentralizing wealth, reinvesting it into communities, improving the community through day-to-day actions, making a positive impact, bridging the gap between short-term relief and long-term sustainable change, supporting local charities, growing the community of partners, promoting linked prosperity, empowering community members, providing equal opportunities, and fostering collaboration among various stakeholders. These shared goals aim to create a thriving and inclusive community where everyone benefits from the collective efforts towards positive change.

believe in Linked Prosperity meaning that as our business grows our community of partners should benefit and grow alongside us You can learn more about Our Promise here Our three Creators for The Healing Project were paid 50 for their time and earn 5-12 from every sale Additionally 10 of all revenue will be donated to our two charity partners on this project Guelph-Wellington Women in Crisis and Sexual Assault and Support Centre Waterloo Region Helping you build a better community One of  Certified B Corporations in Ontario About  Donate  Services  Projects  Privacy Policy  Contact We will only send you emails once a month and share things that we’ll be excited to receive ourselves

working alongside our partners as they create meaningful change for themselves in their own lives The Community Company has collaborated with seven amazing individuals overcoming adversity and has co-created seven beautiful products - we’ve taught our partners how to fish or at least the essential elements of fishing While I love the fish expression and everything it stands for I don’t think it’s enough It’s not enough to simply teach our partners how to fish When I started my project I had access to materials programs and a network of professors and thought-leaders to mentor me through uncertainty This was a privilege that I had and it gave me a leg up on so many other just-as-worthy individuals in our community who wanted to start a business The obvious question is what’s stopping our community partners from having the same support system that I had The next chapter of our project will be about empowering our partners to join us at the pond My vision for this project is to create a
